publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Ad illustrissimum & maximi tum ingenij tum animi virum, Dom. Robertum Sherlaeum, E∣quitem Anglum Regis Persarum nomine ad Europae PP. legatum.

monogr.title: Sir Robert Sherley, sent ambassadour in the name of the King of Persia, to Sigismond the Third, King of Poland and Swecia, and to other princes of Europe : his royall entertainement into Cracovia, the chiefe citie of Poland, with his pretended comming into England : also, th honourable praises of the same Sir Robert Sherley, giuen vnto him in that kingdome, are here likewise inserted
monogr.author: Middleton, Thomas

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: Ad illustrissimum & maximi tum ingenij tum animi virum, Dom. Robertum Sherlaeum, Equitem Anglum Regis Persarum nomine ad Europae PP. legatum.

lg.l: AEmule Honos Animo Proauis, Lux alta, Britannae
Qui gentis pessum non sinis ire Decus;
Non vni dat Cuncta Polus, sed Carmina Apollo,
Haec cuncta vnus habes, est vis, sunt ora deserta,
Numina auara aliis, prodiga facta tibi;
Persia seiactat gemino in te munere, Martis
Tantus honore licet, te Scoti hannd subtrahe Vena,
At Venam excedit pondere vatis Amor.
Immò Censendum satis est Cecinisse Poetam
Quod tibi se fassus carmine & ore rudem;
Parua loquor, ne te venturis subtrahe saeclis:
At Fidei, ut Famae sue sce parare modum.
